pageContext.claim: “This was the greatest five billion dollar website. Five billion was supposed to cost five million.”
pageContext.analysis: The Obamacare website did not cost $5 billion. The Department of Health and Human Services offered an estimate that topped $800 million. A study by Bloomberg News, with a more expansive definition of federal spending, came up with an estimate of $2.1 billion. Moreover, while the website had trouble in its early months, those were quickly fixed and it now works. It was never expected to cost just $5 million.
